title: Hospitality & Tourism (2024): Introduction to Hospitality and Tourism
subject: CTE

A20CE0851A724287AD708FB3F40AFE42.description: Explore the State of Florida “palm tree” initiative for hotels and their level of sustainability.

B372EDA5EE164EC396DA018CF2E08EF6.description:
Identify common sustainable practices used to reduce a property’s carbon footprint and reduce operating
costs.

8FFD9B94F310469183658C9BCE115C54.description: Identify common sustainable practices of various departments within hospitality & tourism industry.

D8949921B0EA42998ED38BD10881E40C.description: Research conservation and sustainable initiatives in the hospitality industry. The student will be able to:

E0728E33C1F549938418D51673D8CD8B.description:
Describe front desk functions of various industry properties distinguishing between property types (i.e., cruise
ship vs. resort vs. hotel vs. restaurant).

CFCFB438F85142ACAD0139FC17128B48.description:
Describe the importance of a safety plans for various emergency situations (e.g., hurricane, evacuation,
tornado, homeland security threat, and fire) relative to all types of tourism (hotel, cruise, attractions, etc.).

745DEC2CAC034FB7AA1012D2AB5190C4.description:
Identify the organizational structure of various departments including: facilities and engineering, food and
beverage, human resources, controller/finance, sales and marketing, security and rooms/housekeeping.

E3602E4CAD6F40B98E540DF6BFFF2D03.description:
Identify and describe the organizational structures and operations within various industry properties. The student will
be able to:

BF31AF98A48E4F248350C567DECED7C9.description:
Understand the value and impact of calculation of hotel occupancy, average daily rate (ADR) and revenue
available room (RevPAR).

CC6E91E1A5D0440CB091ED68D60F5B94.description:
Identify different payment options (e.g., cash, checks, credit/debit cards, emerging technology, alternative
digital payment options, and incentive program points).

A44E8A5248D24A7CBD61BDF4578EFF62.description:
Identify universal terminology used in hospitality and tourism sales-related transactions (e.g., cash, emerging
technology, digital payment alternatives, checks, debit cards, credit cards, discounts, etc.).

27BDD981918041D9BA58C1E5D05FB325.description: Recognize mathematical operations related to hospitality and tourism occupations. The student will be able to:

B771BFFCE6E642E3B3C1E905356E7EE7.description:
Explain motivation, needs, and expectations of the hospitality and tourism consumer and how it affects their
lodging selection.

9BF9BD0F610F426086045D63061DD104.description:
Identify effective sales techniques (e.g., steps in sales process, cross-selling, upselling and alternative
options).

DC5AA750D2FE434A98A6606E6077C50C.description:
Discuss the importance of meeting specialized sales needs (e.g., business travel, conventions and meetings,

4D74804A27E5461CB0F66E4F4ECC9189.description: Recognize purpose, principles, and importance of selling.

EE3B52B85E214EB7A31552E4FF2FB4A1.description: Identify methods of gathering customer feedback.

1CE692ED0EE2431CA4EA2D6FADA333D8.description: Discuss the role of federal, state and local regulatory agencies related to the hospitality and tourism industry.

98E9E56E3F1D43709CFC0244814F3A26.description:
Identify niche markets (customer segmentation) and specialty markets (product segmentation, sports,
shopping, religion, etc.).

F4C6A3D5BE944522A7D64C22E809E75A.description: Recognize various marketing channels used to promote destinations and products.

5DDF9C10096E4BF985C60538F2221B28.description: Recognize concept of target markets and market identification (e.g., market segmentation).

8A7DAB212F294C13BABD51D081EEC6DB.description: Distinguish between concepts of service vs. product marketing strategies.

42C9AB5CABF343CA9012EFCC96851FAA.description: Identify functions of the business and marketing plan.

7B352116DA414F2EB9D4193BBDCED140.description: Identify elements in the marketing mix (price, product, promotion, place, and people).

1DF5BD84321F4FF5BB90D2D6A96085CD.description: Explain marketing and its role in the industry and the free enterprise system.

FCBC1A87D5B948818F5657EC74964CBA.description:
Examine marketing and business fundamentals as they relate to the hospitality and tourism industry. The student will
be able to:

855400A3D57A4691867BA975FD888BB2.description: Discuss role of employee productivity in contributing to profit margin (bottom line).

1DE7E32CF47F401CB118520E6886AC44.description: Identify advantages and disadvantages of primary forms of business ownership.

E8E02445733A4F03927FC3AA6F9FB391.description: Explain the impact of tourism on local, state, national, and international economies.

82B7ED626A664214ABF02C453B1FFEAC.description: Identify economic opportunities in the industry from both entrepreneurship and employment perspectives.

0BF18E0920DB436B81825DE17DC44CC9.description: Examine economic principles relative to the hospitality and tourism industry. The student will be able to:

156D304740CF48218215A2BD222645DF.description: Create an artistic presentation to innovatively address a guest problem.

AB765A7F95CA48F8A3C0675C1D47C35D.description: Explain how and why guest satisfaction measurements help a business run smoothly and profitably.

17EABD92D7D343DDBEEDFD274859280F.description: Identify the role of guest recovery during the handling of guest complaints, issues, or problems.

A88EF2791CFF4542AF708CB39D938B9D.description: Explain the objective of providing seamless guest experiences.

3DC20C066041466BB09235F4F4B97C80.description:
Recognize the effect communication (body language, foreign phrases, acronyms/jargon, etc.) has on the guest
cycle process.

89A3CE7D798C4036906332DFD8FCEC51.description:
Explain the importance and impact of sensitivity to diversities (i.e., cultural, religious, socio-economic, etc.) in
relation to the guest cycle process.

5262D146082545869B13915FDA2DF2F4.description: Discuss the value of customer feedback and follow-up surveys on the guest cycle process.

B3E6F2531C9E4FEE9AD1B0683E7E11BE.description: Recognize the impact social media has on the guest cycle process.

EEC776C91C054AD2A7198550E20E2918.description: Identify the stages of the guest experience cycle and the activities associated with each stage.

FD6313CB93CE4A24B7D15DCDAC65F29A.description: Examine the guest cycle process. The student will be able to:

9CC8B83847EE4D0288971A503B121D25.description:
Locate and explain information found in trade journals, manuals, graphs, schedules, charts, diagrams, maps,
and Internet to prepare an itinerary.

EFDAB3DB7AB44B25982786148854038D.description: Use digital equipment to create artistic images and deliver an oral presentation.

510FDACD52ED4965B59B839B229B3107.description:
Discuss importance of providing clear directions, interpretations, descriptions, and explanations and active
listening skills.

BEC902B2BEBF4216BC152FF5F3730B80.description: Discuss importance of developing networking skills to expand contacts within the industry.

BAC4EDA8CECF42B88B93E42CD683DB06.description: Demonstrate effective etiquette/netiquette in a business situation.

79CFBEE7D03D4FEDAC0FB809FD5B671E.description:
Identify techniques of appropriate phone etiquette (i.e., answering, placing on hold, recording messages,
transferring and complaint telephone calls).

0B78CA02422B40ACB04434D93066E570.description:
Use novel/original approach in creating problem-solving techniques to resolve customer-service conflicts (i.e.,
complaints, disputes, negotiations, etc.).

D14FFBA87B2946AE8B2F1239BB9BD3D7.description: Describe positive guest/client relations and identify circumstances that lead to negative customer experiences.

9EC4F95628234453A7E221AFC6359E6F.description:
Research social and professional networking websites (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.), and explain how
these sites affect the hospitality industry and its employees.

AECF190761944FFFB8807A1C0552D4E4.description:
Use technology to compose a business letter, memorandums, e-mail, and company social media
communications (i.e., press release).

30D5A91F608C4DEB8F2D1D5B98B05F4F.description:
Describe effective staff communication and its uses (i.e., interpersonal, departmental, interdepartmental,
company).

353B8854F3514288B2CBA921A6F1CD5C.description: Examine communication and technology skills in the hospitality and tourism industry. The student will be able to:

10E89FBB645E4A12AA9CCF4858623D53.description:
Express importance of supporting and following company policies and procedures (e.g., attendance, tardiness,
email policy, social media, dress code) and how their actions effect clients.

A9FBF849A9114DF9835CA971BA1547AA.description: Explain importance of maintaining confidentiality of business matters.

4DA034BEB3B44A57B5564B30C2A5E61E.description: Compare and contrast appropriate/inappropriate workplace social behavior and work ethics.

D79FEE35B3A6495ABFAE5C4D3F831B5F.description:
Demonstrate ability to use creative problem-solving, decision-making, and critical-thinking strategies and
accept feedback/constructive criticism.

FEBF4C7FA2194813B5E0B81B35A09748.description: Identify, define, and demonstrate professional interpersonal skills and personality traits.

43F0C20FD7704726A5ADB5FDF3A92796.description:
Identify sensitive workplace issues and laws that regulate them (e.g., gender equity, cultural diversity,
professional ethics, sexual harassment, disability, age discrimination).

E826D74FCED745BEBF762ACB2C2AE99B.description:
Demonstrate ability to work cooperatively with team members, supervisors, and guests from diverse cultural
and socio-economic backgrounds.

31938ECD2F9E4A66BAFAF712012C5969.description: Identify qualities necessary to be an effective team player.

12164B63D2664273BB13B6DD41E05B46.description: Identify qualities typically required for career advancement (e.g., productivity, dependability, responsibility).

AEFA361128AC4B15ABF642C4D84C7E80.description:
Demonstrate time management skills with on-task behavior and self-pacing in accomplishing work
assignments.

F7188B4205BE4F94ACBAFBF292B7987A.description:
Demonstrate the use of software products as they pertain to the industry (i.e., templates, spreadsheets,
customer and vendor databases and industry-related products).

9CA793D973664A5FADD3E4B2649C648A.description:
Discuss importance of drug tests and criminal background checks in the application process and how they
impact employment.

8E378F4D1944457B83EBE118E652A24F.description: Identify strategies for handling inappropriate interview and application questions.

CB8F6D99533F457792B73076E5F2734A.description:
Identify and demonstrate effective interviewing skills to include appropriate responses to common interview
questions.

A1CB2F3350FA4DAD961E4F0EE1BEAEBF.description: Identify and demonstrate appropriate dress and grooming for employment.

521B0011F2A4417B8FA631017DEBA8CA.description:
Use technology to create and organize a digital professional portfolio (i.e., personal statement, student work
and presentations).

DE112921D6734D6CBE22CCA72A674B7E.description: Create a customized resume, cover letter, follow-up, and thank you letters.

CA46EB34CDA040D8BAEB6386DE5E28BF.description:
Identify steps in the application process and documents required when applying for employment (e.g.,
application, references, W-4, I-9).

33556361A5BA40ADBF000F5432D066FD.description: Participate in a discussion on ways social media may negatively impact job search and career.

E9B08F1C0D8C4B41B197B1E808B94F1A.description:
Identify and utilize resources used in a job search for a hospitality and tourism related career (e.g., networking
with professional organizations, social media, Internet).

3B0AA17FB1F14CDE8522DC7E52C55ECE.description:
Demonstrate employability skills necessary for success in hospitality and tourism occupations. The student will be
able to:

0897FCAE776C46F79BCADF142EFF6612.description:
Use technology applications, tools and artistic skills to promote social and cultural awareness related to
industry concerns.

054F33A13CC543DAA2CDAB4E041F019E.description:
Research the official Florida tourism website and local visitor websites; compare them to other state and local
visitor sites.

1C1732309E7D4A93B1DB3EED59F9EF02.description:
Explain economic factors that affect the hospitality and tourism industry (i.e., fuel costs, airline industry
consolidations, politics, exchange rates, availability of consumer’s discretionary money, state tax).

5993036230454AC4A26015CA8A40A58C.description:
Identify components of leisure and business travel in the hospitality and tourism industry, including the role of
conventions, sporting events and special events.

C441CB9360894593B856E65E0FAAF12F.description:
Identify types of food service operations, emerging trends (i.e., home delivery services, Uber Eats, etc.),
segments, franchises and ownership structures.

936B60E7B9164DC49E07234D474DB227.description:
Discuss and identify aspects of the cruise industry and types of cruise ships (luxury, mega, adventure, and
river).

4B484ABD39D34BE58A90F1C3ADD226BD.description:
Explain factors that affect room rates and package plans (such as seasonality, property management, revenue
management, booking engines, events, occupancy percentage, etc.).

CBD5FC1D2EE24CB998FB0530905B01B2.description: Identify types of lodging properties and ownership structures (e.g., Air BnB, VRBO, etc.).

09BB4A3BE726452795F2AD5397A43888.description:
Identify modes and uses of transportation and discuss advantages/disadvantages of each (i.e., ground, air and
sea transportation, Uber/Rideshare.).

45441003596D489B9EABCBAF339ADA71.description:
Identify current and emerging trends in the hospitality and tourism industry (e.g., staycations, daycations,
ecotourism, share economy vendors, medical tourism).

BC41346E182E4081882C1CD940A9F9FD.description: Distinguish features of different travel and social media websites.

E11BDCF2CE9A40C2AF8D88A76E68A821.description:
Identify factors that influence a traveler to select a travel destination (e.g., weather, culture, climate, cost,
natural resources, travel alerts, and medical factors).

138041E78A344438B264705D34D82E6D.description:
Identify the travel documents and security mandates required by travelers for both international/domestic
travel and recognize the impact of improper documentation (i.e., TSA compliance).

55FEDDE5A95E460AB6095AEF86E0E8C0.description:
Summarize the history and development of the hospitality and tourism industry (i.e., airline deregulation,
highway system, and globalization) as well as the changes and growth the tourism industry has experienced.

797700D0BB6943B69B570175BF6C4D55.description: Research the various aspects of the hospitality and tourism industry. The student will be able to:

14425A9190654E5CAAF29101303AAFA0.description: Using media techniques, tools and process communicate trends and aspects in hospitality & tourism industry.

95A48BB16B32456AAF95C8182BEE0840.description: Represent a career in the hospitality & tourism industry by performance or art.

8EF2A040AA484263992937171112826D.description: Identify business, professional, student industry associations and available industry certifications.

359C0BA1B2834053B16C022B2CB6BD85.description: Understand the differences between international, domestic and local hospitality and tourism.

7F41A09461D449B4A877BD063F256424.description: Develop an understanding of terminology and acronyms used the hospitality & tourism industry.

E58251DC8D0D48079EF5C58B9CFEC71A.description: Develop an individualized education and career plan related to the hospitality and tourism industry.

E6A8F4C554264E1684571334D45FAD59.description:
Complete a self-assessment and analysis of lifestyle goals and aspirations to evaluate for employment
suitability in the hospitality and tourism industry.

6335E2405A5F46B0AE69BD6B931834C2.description: Identify advantages and disadvantages by industry components working in the hospitality and tourism industry.

789C325197A04A7E834B3CB509D33047.description:
Identify requirements for entry and career advancement by industry component in the hospitality and tourism
industry.

01B547BB5E034BBDA4EBA19A2C1553DD.description: Identify skills and knowledge needed by hospitality and tourism professionals.

5D9C755FB4E348CF896BF35F1E621B70.description: Explain duties and responsibilities for the identified hospitality and tourism positions.

A41D0836FF81400B92FA38D56F19BEC6.description:
List career positions in a variety of hospitality and tourism-related industry components (i.e., ground
transportation, cruise, air travel, accommodations, food service, share economy marketing, retail, corporate
travel, leisure and recreation travel, conventions and special events, destination marketing organizations,
emerging fields and sports venues, etc.).

EECAAC2619E94BF0BBE33CD0D869A6EB.description: Identify careers in the hospitality and tourism industry. The student will be able to:
